verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764> upon Neginah <WH5058>, A Psalm of David <WH1732>. Hear <WH8085> <WH8798> my cry <WH7440>, O 'Elohim <WH430>; attend <WH7181> <WH8685> unto my prayer <WH8605>.

From the end <WH7097> of the earth <WH776> will I cry <WH7121> <WH8799> unto thee, when my heart <WH3820> is overwhelmed <WH5848> <WH8800>: lead <WH5148> <WH8686> me to the rock <WH6697> that is higher <WH7311> <WH8799> than I.
For thou hast been a shelter <WH4268> for me, and a strong <WH5797> tower <WH4026> from <WH6440> the enemy <WH341> <WH8802>.
I will abide <WH1481> <WH8799> in thy tabernacle <WH168> for ever <WH5769>: I will trust <WH2620> <WH8799> in the covert <WH5643> of thy wings <WH3671>. Selah <WH5542>.
For thou, O 'Elohim <WH430>, hast heard <WH8085> <WH8804> my vows <WH5088>: thou hast given <WH5414> <WH8804> me the heritage <WH3425> of those that fear <WH3373> thy name <WH8034>.
Thou wilt prolong <WH3254> <WH8686> the king's <WH4428> life <WH3117> <WH3117>: and his years <WH8141> as many <WH1755> generations <WH1755>.
He shall abide <WH3427> <WH8799> before <WH6440> 'Elohim <WH430> for ever <WH5769>: O prepare <WH4487> <WH8761> mercy <WH2617> and truth <WH571>, which may preserve <WH5341> <WH8799> him.
So will I sing <WH2167> <WH8762> praise unto thy name <WH8034> for ever <WH5703>, that I may daily <WH3117> <WH3117> perform <WH7999> <WH8763> my vows <WH5088>.
